segment.source: How to Add a Package Version
segment.target: How to Add a Package Version

segment.source: How to Add a Package Version
segment.target: How to Add a Package Version

segment.source: How to Add a Package Version
segment.target: How to Add a Package Version

segment.source: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, when you resequence a package, you can use the following procedure to add the new version to your servers for streaming.
segment.target: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, when you resequence a package, you can use the following procedure to add the new version to your servers for streaming.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When you upgrade a package with a new version, you can leave the existing version in place or delete it and leave only the newest one.
segment.target: When you upgrade a package with a new version, you can leave the existing version in place or delete it and leave only the newest one.

segment.source: You might want to leave the old version in place for compatibility with legacy documents or so that you can test the new version before making it available to all users.
segment.target: You might want to leave the old version in place for compatibility with legacy documents or so that you can test the new version before making it available to all users.

segment.source: To add a package version
segment.target: To add a package version

segment.source: Copy the new SFT file to the application server's content folder.
segment.target: Copy the new SFT file to the application server's content folder.

segment.source: If resequencing did not add changes to the Open Software Descriptor (OSD), icon (ICO), or Sequencer Project (SPRJ) files, you do not need to copy those.
segment.target: If resequencing did not add changes to the Open Software Descriptor (OSD), icon (ICO), or Sequencer Project (SPRJ) files, you do not need to copy those.

segment.source: You can include those files if you want all the files to display the same date.
segment.target: You can include those files if you want all the files to display the same date.

segment.source: In left pane of the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, expand the Packages node.
segment.target: In left pane of the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, expand the Packages node.

segment.source: Right-click the package you want to upgrade, and choose Add Version.
segment.target: Right-click the package you want to upgrade, and choose Add Version.

segment.source: In the Add Package Version dialog box, browse for or type the path name for the new application file in the Full path for package file field.
segment.target: In the Add Package Version dialog box, browse for or type the path name for the new application file in the Full path for package file field.

segment.source: This must be an SFT file.
segment.target: This must be an SFT file.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: The Summary dialog box shows the file location and prompts you to copy the file there if you have not already done so.
segment.target: The Summary dialog box shows the file location and prompts you to copy the file there if you have not already done so.

segment.source: Click Finish after you have verified the information.
segment.target: Click Finish after you have verified the information.

segment.source: The new version is now complete and ready to stream.
segment.target: The new version is now complete and ready to stream.
